page.title: 06HOUSING IN WOODLAND
page.content: Most houses are{owner occupied.}There are some Council houses in Woodland but people can buy their Council houses if they wish. Most buildings are built from sandstone. Some modern houses have two bathrooms and a toilet upstairs and one down or an extra one outside. In Teesdale there are a lot of old buildings that must be left as they are,{planning permission}is needed before any alterations can be carried out on buildings old or new. My house is 160 years old and was once a public house called The Black Horse Inn that is where the street gets it name from. Before we could extend our house it had to be sandblasted to{restore}the old stone. Many houses are being{renovated}and central heating installed.
